saf.core.ui.util

Class DirectoryChooser

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JFileChooser
            • com.l2fprod.common.swing.JDirectoryChooser
              • saf.core.ui.util.DirectoryChooser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DirectoryChooser
extends com.l2fprod.common.swing.JDirectoryChooser
    File chooser for directories. This inherits from JDirectory chooser which inherits from FileChooser so all that is availble here.
    Author:
    Nick Collier
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectoryChooser

        public DirectoryChooser()
        Constructs a DirectoryChooser pointing to the user's default directory. This default depends on the operating system. It is typically the "My Documents" folder on Windows, and the user's home directory on Unix.

      • DirectoryChooser

        public DirectoryChooser(java.io.File currentDirectory)
        Constructs a DirectoryChooser using the given File as the path. Passing in a null file causes the file chooser to point to the user's default directory. This default depends on the operating system. It is typically the "My Documents" folder on Windows, and the user's home directory on Unix.
        Parameters:
        currentDirectory - a File object specifying the path to a file or directory

      • DirectoryChooser

        public DirectoryChooser(java.io.File currentDirectory,
                javax.swing.filechooser.FileSystemView fsv)
        Constructs a DirectoryChooser using the given current directory and FileSystemView.

      • DirectoryChooser

        public DirectoryChooser(java.lang.String currentDirectoryPath)
        Constructs a DirectoryChooser using the given path. Passing in a null string causes the file chooser to point to the user's default directory. This default depends on the operating system. It is typically the "My Documents" folder on Windows, and the user's home directory on Unix.
        Parameters:
        currentDirectoryPath - a String giving the path to a file or directory

      • DirectoryChooser

        public DirectoryChooser(java.lang.String currentDirectoryPath,
                javax.swing.filechooser.FileSystemView fsv)
        Constructs a DirectoryChooser using the given current directory path and FileSystemView.

      • DirectoryChooser

        public DirectoryChooser(javax.swing.filechooser.FileSystemView fsv)
        Constructs a DirectoryChooser using the given FileSystemView.
